result.execSummary:
The defendant Noah J Atkisson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Commit a Battery on Person [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with probation in La Crosse Co cases 13CF818 and 13CM1994, with conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing to ensure abstinence

No Contact with Forrest H., his family, or his residence
.

Comply with Mediation Services if/when it becomes available, if the victim wishes to participate

Submit DNA sample

Pay restitution of $792.46 plus 10% restitution surcharge(will be listed under 'other';  restitution to be left open for 45 days to determine any additional restitution owed.

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignement

Complete any other programming or assessment deemed appropriate by the PO

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Cash bond of $1000 will be applied to restitution amount owed, once final amount is determined, then 10% surcharge, and any remaining balance will be applied to Court costs/fees owed.  An Assessment report will be done once bond money is applied

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
First 4 months to be served without release, with credit of 27 days applied to the first 4 months of the sentence

Remainder of sentence to be served on Electronic Monitoring with Justice Sanctions
.

supervisions.notes:
During period of prison incarceration, 25% of the defendant's Inmate Prison Account will be applied toward restitution owed, per prison policy
.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to La Crosse Co case 13CF818
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

No Contact with the H. family (victim & their family)
.

Follow through with cognitive behavioral programming

Comply with any other conditions as set by the DOC

Pay outstanding restitution and 10% surcharge as originally ordered

During period of Extended Supervision, restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be applied toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment

Pay outstanding Court financial obligations as originally ordered

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

Kenneth Hey gives statements.  Ron Atkisson-Noah's father gives statements.  Kyle Conkle-Noah's employer gives statements.  Shawn Atkisson-Noah's grandfather gives statements.  Skemp feels probation is appropriate with 1 year CJ with some in custody...  Huh comments.  Noah has his issues...  Putting him in jail will not help him.  That doesn't, in any way, deminish what happened...  He can work through this.  He's made positive changes.  Asks for probation with some jail and consider it on em.  Atkisson gives statements.  Court comments and addresses Noah.
